text: The 1990 Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference Men's Basketball Tournament took place on March 1–3, 1990 at Greensboro Coliseum in Greensboro, North Carolina. Coppin State defeated , 54–50 in the championship game, to win its first MEAC Tournament title. The Eagles earned an automatic bid to the 1990 NCAA Tournament as #15 seed in the Southeast region. ==Format== Eight of nine conference members participated, with play beginning in the quarterfinal round. Teams were seeded based on their regular season conference record. ==Bracket== * denotes overtime period ==References== Category:MEAC Men's Basketball Tournament Category:1989–90 Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference men's basketball season MEAC Men's Basketball Tournament
title: 1990 MEAC Men's Basketball Tournament
